item.title: 8bit Duels Devlog Part 5

Priorities have changed for the better, gameplay mechanics have been established, a community chat has been created, and an artist has joined forces with me to create the game! item.title: 8bit Duels Devlog Part 4
item.description: Hello! Welcome to the fourth part of my devlog where I develop my multiplayer turn-based game. I previously didn’t have a name, but I have decided to name it 8bit Duels! I think this fits the theme pretty nicely. Anyways, on with the devlog! Refactoring This devlog is all about refactoring, and how I made my code cleaner. I did this by creating a workspace shared between the client and the server.

item.title: 8bit Duels Devlog Part 3
item.description: Hello Readers! Welcome to the third devlog on this series where I code a multiplayer turn-based strategy game! If you haven’t read the three previous posts, go check them out! This week, I created a simple and exciting selecting system for my troops. Without further ado, let’s get into it. Hope you enjoy! Troop selecting In the last devlog, I talk about how I implemented the spawning mechanism in my game.

item.title: 8bit Duels Devlog Intro
item.description: Hello readers! This is a short post introducing my first blog series, where I will document my process creating a multiplayer turn-based game. The game is not named yet. Below is what I’ll explore in this post: What I’m making: in this section, I’ll tell a bit more about what kind of game I’m making as well as what are my expectations and goals for this project. Language and tools: I will cover the technology stack behind my game.
